com.iota.iri.utils.log

Interface ProgressLogger

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    IntervalProgressLogger

    public interface ProgressLogger
    Represents a wrapper for the Logger used by IRI that implements a logic to report the progress of a single task. The progress is calculated by comparing the current step to the expected step count and shown as a percentage value.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      Marks the task as failed and triggers the output of a status message informing us about the failure.

      ProgressLogger start(int stepCount)
      Does the same as start() but sets the expected step count to the given value.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        ProgressLogger start()
        Starts the logging by (re)setting the current step to 0 and trigger the output of the current progress.
        Returns:
        the logger itself to allow the chaining of calls

      • start

        ProgressLogger start(int stepCount)
        Does the same as start() but sets the expected step count to the given value. This allows us to initialize and start the logging in a single call.
        Parameters:
        stepCount - number of steps that the task involves
        Returns:
        the logger itself to allow the chaining of calls

      • progress

        ProgressLogger progress()
        Increases the current step by one and triggers the output of the current progress. This should be called whenever we finish a sub task.
        Returns:
        the logger itself to allow the chaining of calls

      • progress

        ProgressLogger progress(int currentStep)
        Sets the current step to the given value and triggers the output of the current progress.
        Parameters:
        currentStep - the current step that was just finished
        Returns:
        the logger itself to allow the chaining of calls

      • finish

        ProgressLogger finish()
        Sets the current step to the expected step count and triggers the output of the current progress. This allows us to dump the progress when the processing of the task succeeds.
        Returns:
        the logger itself to allow the chaining of calls

      • abort

        ProgressLogger abort()
        Marks the task as failed and triggers the output of a status message informing us about the failure.
        Returns:
        the logger itself to allow the chaining of calls

      • abort

        ProgressLogger abort(java.lang.Throwable reason)
        Marks the task as failed and triggers the output of a status message informing us about the failure. The shown error message will contain the reason for the error given by the passed in Exception.
        Parameters:
        reason - reason for the failure
        Returns:
        the logger itself to allow the chaining of calls

      • getCurrentStep

        int getCurrentStep()
        Returns the current finished step of this logger.
        Returns:
        current finished step of this logger

      • setCurrentStep

        ProgressLogger setCurrentStep(int currentStep)
        Sets the current step to the given value without triggering an output.
        Parameters:
        currentStep - the current step that was just finished
        Returns:
        the logger itself to allow the chaining of calls

      • getStepCount

        int getStepCount()
        Returns the expected step count of this logger.
        Returns:
        the expected step count of this logger

      • setStepCount

        ProgressLogger setStepCount(int stepCount)
        Sets the expected step count to the given value without triggering an output.
        Parameters:
        stepCount - the expected step count of this logger
        Returns:
        the logger itself to allow the chaining of calls

      • getEnabled

        boolean getEnabled()
        This method is the getter for the enabled flag of the logger. If the logger is disabled it will simply omit showing log messages.
        Returns:
        true if the logger shall output messages and false otherwise (the logger is enabled by default)

      • setEnabled

        ProgressLogger setEnabled(boolean enabled)
        This method is the setter for the enabled flag of the logger. If the logger is disabled it will simply omit showing log messages.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true if the logger shall output messages and false otherwise (the logger is enabled by default)
        Returns:
        the logger itself to allow the chaining of calls
